TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WizardStepCollectionEditor extends System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a design-time editor in a design host such as [!INCLUDE[vsprvslong](../../add/includes/vsprvslong-md.md)] for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Type"> of items in the collection.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WizardStepCollectionEditor"> class using the given <xref:System.Type>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool CanSelectMultipleInstances() cil managed

Docs.summary: Indicates whether multiple instances may be selected.
Docs.returns: `true` if multiple items can be selected at once; otherwise, `false`. This implementation always returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor/CollectionForm CreateCollectionForm() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new form to display and edit the current collection.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.CollectionForm> to provide as the user interface for editing the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance object CreateInstance(class System.Type itemType) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Type"> of collection to create.
Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the collection of the specified <see cref="T:System.Type">.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Type[] CreateNewItemTypes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the data types this collection can contain.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The default implementation looks in the collection for the Item property and returns the returning Type of the item. Do not call this directly. Instead, use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor.NewItemTypes%2A> property of the base class. Use the CreateNewItemTypes method to override the default implementation.
